content: Founded 1998 in Colombo, Sri Lanka. Started with dial-up internet (56 kbps). Vision: affordable, reliable telecom for every Sri Lankan household.
1998: First dial-up service. 2001: First private ISP fiber network (Colombo-Kandy). 2003: ADSL broadband launched (512 kbps). 2007: 'Gama' initiative - rural internet.
2008: Mobile spectrum acquired. 2009: Mobile data launched. 2010: 3G coverage all major cities. 2011: First unlimited mobile data plan 'Anantha'.
2013: 4G LTE launched in Colombo. 2016: Extensive population coverage. 2017: 'Digital Lanka' - free public Wi-Fi initiative.
2018: FTTH launched (gigabit speeds). Rapid expansion in Colombo, Gampaha, Kandy. COVID-19: Accelerated deployment, work-from-home packages.
2021: Commercial 5G in Colombo. 'LankaTel Smart' - IoT for smart cities and agriculture. Ongoing nationwide 5G expansion.
1998: Company founded. 2001: First private fiber. 2003: ADSL launched. 2009: Mobile services. 2011: First unlimited data. 2013: 4G LTE. 2018: FTTH. 2021: 5G commercial.
Best ISP Sri Lanka (World Communication Awards). Most Innovative Telecom (South Asian Summit). Best Employer (Great Place to Work). CSR Excellence (Ceylon Chamber). Green Telecom (ITU Asia Pacific).
Total LKR 50+ billion since 1998. Major phases: Fiber network (LKR 2B), ADSL (LKR 8B), Mobile (LKR 15B), 4G (LKR 12B), FTTH (LKR 10B), 5G (LKR 8B).
Milestones: 10k (2002), 50k (2006), 100k (2009), 500k (2013), 1M (2016), 2M (2019), 3M (2022). Growth across dial-up, ADSL, mobile, fiber.
